name: TheAtlantic
text: The summer’s end may be more bittersweet than usual, as Americans prepare to enter a season that will, for many, make socializing safely even trickier. The latest Atlantic Daily by @mimbsy: https://t.co/AOQez5HaiJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: This is my favorite @arthurbrooks column yet. On the unexpected power of lifequakes, highly recommend: https://t.co/deQ1RHLRe0

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: .@RadioFreeTom: "The only decent, sensible, and conservative position is to vote against this Republican Party at every level, and bring the sad final days of a once-great political institution to an end."

Read the whole piece here: 
https://t.co/DBYDQMWdWp

name: TheAtlantic
text: In the past month, the number of coronavirus tests reported in the United States has drifted down—and that may be partly because of Trump-administration policy, write @alexismadrigal and @yayitsrob: https://t.co/l4usk0tLzJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Constitution denied her enslaved ancestors the right to full citizenship. Generations later, @dsallentess on how the document also established a foundation of freedom for all. https://t.co/qhlNpw7g1i

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: The pandemic is getting harder to track: The US conducts 100,000 fewer virus tests each day now than it did in July.

That’s due to White House meddling and the arrival of new types of test, @alexismadrigal and I report: https://t.co/koHX70QINx

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Photos: Wildfires Rage Across the American West - 35 images from recent days in Washington, Oregon, and California, where dozens of wildfires have erupted, driven by dry winds, burning thousands of acres, and spreading thick smoke across the Pacific coast. https://t.co/kuIBVIC0JW https://t.co/7ILYTaXUQk

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: In the frenzy of homeschooling, schools might be ignoring one of the most potent sources of help, one built into many families: the grandparents. Elders are lonely and have more time on their hands than parents—it’s a win-win, @robinhenig argues:
https://t.co/SzfzTdcMKU

name: TheAtlantic
text: Schools might be ignoring a potent source of help, one built into many families. These people have the best interests of the children at heart and are likely less overtaxed than parents of students: the grandparents. "Use us," @robinhenig writes: https://t.co/o6qxvIfDGC

name: TheAtlantic
text: Democrats learned a lesson from the 2000 recount fight: They can't cede the streets to the GOP, @RonBrownstein writes. https://t.co/BuB8MNcZgw

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The president’s tendency to view everything as a sales-and-marketing problem, inherited from his career in the private sector, leads him to seek superficial solutions and avoid addressing root causes," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/izcvPTCOXL

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: "There’s simply nowhere to go." @Emma_Marris on the claustrophobia of being caught between the fires and the virus is so good: https://t.co/TdNeEdBJxj

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Why does the grief of 2020—when the coronavirus pandemic has actually filled hospitals in New York and in communities across the country—feel so different? Why does our country, so united after 9/11, feel so splintered now?" @vermontgmg writes: https://t.co/GlXzp9W0TB
